(Was at the Chicago conference on Higher Education. Kerry
Smith is rather keen on my approach, I may ad^d , in case
he can be of help to NAEB in this project. I ran into some
opposition from the audio-visual groups, naturally. Let
us say, then, that, whereas print led the world from "status
to contract", today print has become status itself, and
electronics are now leading us from status to contact. Our
media now must be contact-oriented ,rather than protective
devices for private prestige.)
Breakthrough No.Is
Detribalization of backward countries we carry out
via literacy^assembly line, industrial culture. Result is
Individualism and nationalism in these areas, as it was with
us in the 16th century,etc. Meantime we via electricity are
retribalizing ourselves. That is, we create a global village
in which every event vibrates with every other event— including
the violent effects of swift detribalization. But retribal-
ization evokes new yearning for stability, security, and
equilibrium in the old centers of technological innovation.

Breakthrough No.2:
This one is simpler and smaller, perhaps. Reason
why kids "canft read" is because they instinctively now read
in depth— not forward. Like return to manuscript,which was
read almost statically and at several levels at once, with
glosses, illuminations, etc., like comic book or Life mag.
By the same token, high-brow paperbacks can sell to ordinary
readers who formerly read forward at gallop in narrative style.
Serious books can appeal to ordinary readers when read slowly.
Librarians report decline of kid interest in fiction. New
preference for fact books. Same in the big mags. The fact
that article done in cinematic style supplants fiction i n
